0.1: full outside off and a neat push square of the wicket wide of point
0.2: full on middle and off, defended back down the pitch
0.3: pushed across outside off, 81mph, left alone
0.4: on leg stump but he gets away with it as Azam flicks it off his pads and Rashid makes a diving stop at short fine-leg
0.5: back outside off, full length, defended towards mid-off
0.6: good line, full on off stump, 78mph, carefully defended with bat and pad together...a steady opening over
1.1: nicely bowled, adjusts his line to full outside off, draws Azhar forward and he plays a flat-foot drive and almost gets an edge
1.2: down the leg side again, but this time Azhar had moved quite away across his crease the umpire lets it go
1.3: tucked off the pads to square leg
1.4: fuller on middle and leg, nudged just to the right of mid-on
1.5: full outside leg, not quite the right line, deflects off the pad fine of the keeper but the slow outfield ensures it pulls up well before the boundary...in fact, a small edge too
1.6: outside off, driven firmly to mid-off's left
2.1: back of a length outside off, left alone
2.2: driven square off a thickish outside edge towards point
2.3: gets across outside off and whips a full delivery into midwicket
2.4: nice drive this time, gets well forward into a full ball and pierces the gap between cover and mid-off...enough power to overcome the outfield, too
2.5: drags the length back a touch, pushed to mid-off
2.6: back of a length outside off, punched from the back foot to the left of mid-off so he keeps the strike
3.1: nearly draws an edge, angled across outside off, Azhar plays at it and the ball goes on to beat him
3.3: oh dear, Topley's had a bit of a shocker there! The ball was punched back to him, nothing was happening, but he went to throw it back to the keeper and the ball got stuck in his hand and he ended up winging it into space on the leg side to give away a run. A little embarrassing
3.6: good delivery, full at off stump, finds the outside edge but it dies in front of second slip who makes a sharp save
4.1: width outside off and cut through the off side, slow outfield into play
4.2: worked off the pads through square leg
4.3: driven back to the bowler without much timing
4.4: almost a drag on as he goes for an expansive drive, the ball doesn't come on and a thick inside edge dribbles just wide of the stumps
4.6: back of a length, aims to flick it through the on side but just gets taken on the thigh pad
5.1: that's a strong drive, a stride forward and although he wasn't to the pitch he just strikes clean thorugh the line
5.2: not so full this time, dropped into the off side and his Azhar's has gone flying somehow...a collision between him and Topley as the bowler ran across to get to the ball
5.5: better delivery, full and straight, squirts off a thick outside edge into the point area
5.6: very full, on the popping crease, driven off the bottom of the bat towards mid-off...Azhar struggling a little
6.2: works a straight delivery behind square on the leg side with a flick of his wrists
6.3: blimey! That's come out of nowhere. He takes a step down the pitch and then crunches a full delivery straight down the ground over long off
6.4: stays in his crease this time, works a full ball from outside off towards mid-on
6.5: short of a length outside off, defended into the covers
6.6: more strong wrist work, taking a delivery from quite wide outside off and placing to just wide of mid-on
7.2: slower ball, full and wide outside off, can't get it through the off side
7.3: width again, this time he is able to cut it wide of third man although it's just a single
7.4: shorter delivery, Azhar plays it off the back foot, rides it down to third man again
7.5: full at off stump, defended square to point
7.6: that's a sweet straight drive, along the ground this time, very correct from Azam as he leans into a full delivery and sends it straight of mid-off
8.1: short of a length, gets inside the line and tucks it down to long leg
8.2: full at straight, flicked to square leg
8.3: sweetly time with a bottom-handed flick as he whips it off the stumps to mid-on
8.4: a punchy drive off the back foot which finds cover
8.5: finds the gap this time, another neat drive as he drives on the up through the covers
8.6: can't take advantage of some width as he cracks this one straight at cover
9.1: full at middle, 80mph, defended back to Topley
9.2: opens the face and runs this down to third man
9.3: slips out as a full toss but it doesn't cost him as it is flicked straight to short fine-leg
9.4: slower ball, full outside off, presses forward and opens the face to third man
9.5: leans back on the drive, finds point
9.6: down the pitch and gets beaten as Topley pulls his length back, the ball climbs over the top edge
10.1: full outside off, pushed to the covers, and a scream of 'no'
10.2: shorter outside off, played from the back foot this time
10.3: shuffles across his stumps and flicks a length delivery from outside off to deep square
10.4: a bouncer outside off, Azhar sways out of the line, this time it's okay for the umpire
10.5: fuller again, slides off a thick outside edge to third man
10.6: breakthrough! And it's the short ball which works. Entices a hook from this time, he had to drag it from outside off, took mostly top edge and Rashid steadied himself under the catch at long leg
11.1: starts on leg stump, flicked into the deep on the on side
11.2: on off stump, a little short, he has plenty of time to place it off the back foot through the covers
11.3: touch fuller, hint of turn, played with an open face to point
11.4: beats him as he tries to cut away a delivery that skidded on and only just missed off stump
11.5: chips this over mid-on, he came down the track but wasn't to the pitch. Still went through with his shot, dragged it a little, but had legs to get over the infield
12.1: full outside off, pushed square to backwards point
12.2: driven firmly to cover...Root gets a blow on his knee
12.3: angled into the pads, flicked to long leg
12.4: skips across the crease, almost has his feet off the ground as he flicks this to the leg side
12.5: goes for the pull, takes the pad and loops towards Root at slip
12.6: comes forward, defends down by his feet, looked for a single but the ball was quickly closed down
13.1: short outside off, he steps back and cuts through the off side
13.2: this spins a decent amount, but quite slowly and Hafeez flicks to mid-on
13.3: tossed up much more, is actually a low full toss, driven to long-off
13.5: pushed carefully into the off side
13.6: full at leg stump, swept strongly behind square
14.1: full outside off, driven with a closed face into the leg side wide of mid-on
14.2: short of a length at off stump, Woakes has mixed things up quite effectively so far, worked into the leg side
14.3: this full delivery is drilled over the off side, confident shot from Hafeez who didn't bother with much footwork
14.4: straighter delivery, aims to work to the on side and Woakes gets across
14.5: comes forward and defends, slides off the face to point
14.6: pushed square into the off side again, point is quickly onto it to prevent the single
15.1: uses his feet, nicely bowled with a touch more air, pushes to the off side
15.2: short this time, spins away outside off, cut to deep cover
15.3: just over mid-on! Hafeez wanting to attack Rashid again, goes for the lofted option, the bat twisted in his hands a touch, didn't quite get the elevation he wanted but just enough to beat the man on the edge of the circle
15.4: this one has the distance! Down the pitch again, swings it very high into the air and it has the distance to land over the rope at long-on although not by much
15.5: dragged down outside off, flat-batted to deep cover
15.6: full toss which dips down the leg side, tickled fine of short fine-leg
16.1: over the wicket, tossed up on the stumps, tucked to square leg
16.2: goes back in the crease and flicks the ball a little finer for one
16.3: tossed up on middle and off, comes forward and pushes back to the bowler, briefly in the air
16.4: flighted, outside off, driven through the covers
16.5: gets across his stumps and taps one more through mid-on
16.6: Hafeez scuttles out and clips to leg, sends it straight to midwicket
17.1: pushed through outside off, drops back and chops through point
17.2: into the stands this time! Hafeez slaps Rashid upside his head again, walloping a full delivery over wide long-on... Picked the googly, I think
17.3: drags it down a little, pushed back to the bowler
17.4: tossed up outside off, driven through the covers
17.5: pushed through on middle and leg, Azhar clips through midwicket
17.6: floated up on the stumps, Hafeez gets down low to sweep but picks out the fielder
18.1: on the stumps, dabbed into a gap at midwicket and they hustle one
18.2: length ball, spinning in, clips the inside edge and runs square
18.3: flighted around off stump, blocked back to the bowler's left
18.4: down the leg side, just a little tickle of bat on it and the ball runs fine
18.5: presses forward and pushes a driven through mid-on
18.6: there's a clatter of timber, Buttler makes a half-hearted appeal... The ball went into and out of his gloves on to the stumps but was Hafeez's back foot in? Yes, it was indeedy
19.1: tossed up and punched through the covers
19.2: flighted outside off, tapped towards mid-off along the ground
19.3: calamity! Hafeez has run out his captain...! Steered the ball straight to backward point and then called Azhar through, but he was never in the picture, he turns and stops as if to remonstrate, swipes the air with his bat. To be fair, he didn't respond to the initial call and was then up the creek
19.4: gets forward and drives wide of the bowler for one
19.5: spinning away outside off, dabbed through backward point
19.6: on the stumps, whipped to leg and Safraz races through for one more
20.1: pushed into another gap for a busy single
20.2: beats the bat outside off, Hafeez attempting to cut off the back foot
20.5: Sarfraz is up and motoring, smoothly powering a sweep through backward square leg - 100 up for Pakistan
20.6: on the stumps, turned into the leg side but midwicket seizes on it
21.1: pushes the ball back to the bowler
21.2: spinning away outside off, dabbed square
21.4: pushed through outside off, Sarfraz drops back and plays a very late cut for a couple
21.5: tossed up on middle and leg, nudged into the off side
21.6: gives it some air outside off, driven into the covers - tighter over from Rashid
22.1: shout of "catch!" from Moeen as Hafeez chips into a gap on the leg side
22.2: superbly done from Sarfraz, gets lower than Flo Rida Ft. T-Pain and sweeps hard from outside off off stump through backward square leg
22.3: on the stumps, worked to leg
22.4: driven, uppish and is that a drop? Well, hard to call it a chance but Woakes, I think, got fingertips to it diving forward at extra cover
22.6: tossed up and swept hard, bounces out towards deep midwicket
23.1: length ball outside off, dabbed towards backward point
23.2: tossed up and punched into the covers coming forwards
23.3: tossed up and punched into the covers
23.4: nicely bowled, flighted on off stump and turning to beat Hafeez's forward prod
23.5: gets into line and dabs it away - another dot for Rashid
23.6: and that's a rare maiden for him, tossing up the googly to complete the over
24.2: goes down to try and sweep, misses the ball and takes it on the thigh - maybe a little slower from Moeen
24.3: on the stumps, turned to leg
24.4: comes forward and drives to the man in the covers
24.5: flighted, worked across the line, in front of midwicket and they pinch one
24.6: angled in with the arm, blocked back to the bowler
25.1: on the stumps, tucked towards midwicket
25.2: tossed up, goes for the slog-sweep and miscues it along the ground towards long-on
25.3: tossed up, nice and juicy outside off, Sarfraz takes a big bit, getting his front foot out and clubbing past deep extra cover
25.4: tip and run, towards mid-on, the ball is underarmed at the stumps but missed and Sarfraz had made good ground
25.5: pushed through slightly wide, Taylor makes a diving stop at backward point
25.6: width to cut again but Taylor pounces on it in almost identical fashion
26.1: tossed up on the stumps and pushed towards mid-on
26.2: closes the face, gets a leading edge back towards the bowler
26.3: outside off, cut to backward point
26.4: gets down low and sweeps one more through backward square leg
26.6: tossed up on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler - tight few overs from England, nine runs off the last four
27.1: goes across and nudges a length ball to leg
27.2: on the hips, tucked away through backward square
27.3: Willey continues to bowl a leg-stump line, clipped away for one more
27.4: on the legs, nudged square to the man in the deep
27.5: pushed across the batsman, room to free the arms and slap one behind point
27.6: a change of pace deceives Hafeez, he tries to pull and it bops him in the gut
28.1: gets down and sweeps one more through backward square leg
28.3: tossed up on the stumps, can't get the ball past midwicket
28.4: tossed up outside off, driven firmly but straight to the man set back in the covers
28.5: popped back towards the bowler again
28.6: angled in and turned around the corner for a single to finish the over
29.1: length ball around the line of off, pushed in front of square
29.2: low full toss from Willey, the cat-like Sarfraz is low in the crease and into the sweep early, picks out backward square but runs anyway, a direct hit would have been close... Think there was a vain lbw appeal, too, but must have been glove/bat on it first
29.3: length ball, dabbed into the covers
29.4: top-edged out towards deep square leg... and taken! Hafeez's slow wind down comes to its conclusion with a tame flick into the deep, miscued it high to the fielder
29.5: back of a length, tucked away through square
29.6: goes across his stumps and flicks his first ball away for a run
30.1: punched back past the bowler to long-on
30.3: comes charging down the pitch, slogs to leg - and picks out the fielder in the deep! Sarfraz has a brain fart and hands his wicket to Moeen! He was going so well but tried to force it, just after losing his partner
30.4: pushed through flat on off stump, drops back and cut
30.5: flighted, spinning in to hit the inside edge as Malik props forward
30.6: length ball, tapped square from the crease
31.1: pitched up outside off and pushed through the covers into the deep
31.2: back of a length on leg stump, misses with a flick
31.3: pushed into the covers coming forwards
31.4: Willey joining the dots here, as Malik punches a fullish ball to extra cover
31.5: short ball on the stumps, pulled flat through square leg
31.6: full around off stump, slower delivery and Rizwan pats it to cover
32.1: pushed to the right of the bowler for one
32.2: another run-out, Rizwan wandering down the pitch! Either he didn't call or Malik didn't hear it because he wasn't moving, Rizwan realised far too late and Roy was able to scoop the ball up at midwicket, underarm to Buttler, who completed the dismissal
32.3: spinning down the leg side, gets a leading edge
32.5: angled in with the arm, pushed back
32.6: Moeen darts the ball on the stumps, Iftikhar blocks - just one off the over, to go with the run-out
33.1: stays in the crease and blocks
33.2: short of a length, drops back and nudged through square
33.3: dabbed into a gap, Iftikhar is off the mark
33.4: slanted across the right-hander from over the wicket, glided to third man
33.5: goes full around the line of off, driven with a statesmanlike air through mid-off
33.6: slower ball from Willey, hits the toe of the bat as he props forward
34.1: on the stumps, flicked into the leg side
34.2: pushed through on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
34.3: length ball on off, closes the face and turns it to midwicket
34.4: slower, floated up outside off, leans out and defends
34.5: spinning in off a length, goes back and whips it away to deep midwicket for one
34.6: bit of dip, gripping to spin in on off, Iftikhar shows it a straight bat
35.1: full and straight, driven to mid-n
35.2: there's an appeal for lbw by Woakes as this nips back, an off-cutter, and is deflected to third man. Pad first? Hard to tell. Seems to be flap of the front pad. No review used. Going over in any event
35.4: and another! Falling in a heap here. Another short-ball wicket for Woakes as Iftikhar goes to pull, gets elevation but not the distance and picks out deep square-leg.
35.5: tight to off stump, dabbed through backward point
35.6: full at straight, driven to mid-off
36.1: steps back to leg and drives out to deep cover
36.2: appeal for lbw, full around leg stump, Anwar probs forward, probably not straightening enough...might have pitched outside leg, too
36.4: pushed square into the off side and a rare fumble in the field from England by Woakes coming across from point
36.5: another appeal for lbw and this time England use their review. A googly from Rashid, nice spin to beat the inside edge. Has it done too much? Unless there's an edge. Well, hitting in line with off stump is umpire's call and it's also going over
36.6: full and pushed down the ground
37.1: full at the stumps, played back to Woakes in his followthrough
37.2: short ball, over off stump, Anwar ducks
37.3: full outside off, might have been another cutter, patted to the off side
37.5: short delivery dug in, rises fairly gently off the surface, worked around the corner behind square
37.6: push-and-run towards mid-on, it was a bit of a scamper but safe enough
38.2: driven away square through point, but Moeen is quickly around at deep cover
38.3: flicks a full delivery to midwicket
38.4: was that a missed stumping?? Yes, it was. Buttler can't glove it cleanly as Anwar plays over the top of a full delivery. Won't help Buttler's confidence. Anwar was out of his crease for quite some time.
38.5: beaten by one which spins, nice bowling
39.1: full outside off, played to backward point
39.2: shorter delivery, again he can't beat backward point as he opens the face
39.3: this has gone miles in the air and is safely taken! Another bit of pretty brainless cricket from Pakistan as Anwar tries to launch this back towards Dubai, it's a back-of-a-length ball and it gets way underneath it. Moeen does well to settle under a steepler
39.4: full at the stumps, tries to work to the on side but gets it towards mid-off instead
39.5: that's a pretty ugly heave into the leg side, swinging across the line of a full delivery
39.6: full and straight, blocked to the off side
40.2: a length delivery, runs it off the edge to third man
40.3: and another down to third man...it's about all Pakistan can do for the next five or six overs
40.4: short outside off, leaves it alone
40.5: fuller, comes forward and pushes to backward point, Roy very quickly in
40.6: a short-of-a-length cutter which is prodded into the off side
41.2: another run out! Waqar not impressed in the dressing room. It was just nudged into midwicket, Malik came charging up the pitch, it's a swift pick-up by Jordan and a direct hit on the turn. Excellent work, but what has happened to Pakistan?
41.3: flicked off the pads to long leg
41.4: nearly run-out No. 4! He digs out a yorker towards mid-on, Wahab charges out of his crease and has to dive to get back in
41.5: slower ball outside off which he nearly spoons to cover
42.1: low full toss which is squirted down to third man
42.3: full outside off, heaved down the ground to long on
42.5: low full toss, aiming for the yorker, can only get swung to long on
42.6: full on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
43.1: excellent yorker, dug out back to the bowler
43.2: gets beaten by another slower one outside off as he tries to cut
43.3: driven square through the off side
43.4: dropped into the off side, a tight single...could have been close with a direct hit. Probably out with a hit!
43.5: a controlled edge down to third man, he comes back for a dicey second and has to dive to make his crease...the ball bounce awkwardly at Buttler who couldn't gather it. Might have had time to break the stumps
44.1: cut firmly out to deep point
44.2: swings a low full toss in the air over square leg, deep midwicket gets around, they wanted a second for a moment but settled at one
44.3: full outside off, he drives over the top of it
44.5: a boundary! And it's the full lot. Terrific shot on debut, gets good leverage on a full ball, stays in the crease, swings through the line over long-on
44.6: misses out on a low full toss this time, clipped to midwicket
45.2: another cutter, beats him on the inside edge as he aims to the leg side...actually, a back-of-the-hand slower ball
45.3: on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
45.4: good bit of invention now from Gohar, steps across his crease and scoops a full toss behind square...he doesn't lack for confidence
45.5: slices this in the air, down the ground, but it lands short of long off
45.6: another slower one outside off, he misses his dab
46.1: lovely strike and, I think, superb fielding...lofted straight down the ground over mid-off, but it doesn't skip across the outfield and gets flicked back
46.2: swing and a miss to a full ball outside off
46.3: gone this time, swinging to leg against a back-of-a-length delivery and gets a top edge through to Buttler. Been a short-ball day for Woakes
46.4: full outside off, driven to cover
46.5: yorker, dug out to the off side
46.6: full and straight, manages to keep it out with a nudge to mid-on
47.1: full and straight, aims to swing down the ground, slices as the bat turns and lobs towards mid-off but he declines the single
47.2: he's connected this time! Almost a slog-sweep, goes down on one knee and picks it from outside off with a mighty swing over deep midwicket
47.3: dropped! A blemish from England. He heaves this into the leg side, picks out deep square where Root shells one that he would normally swallow
47.4: that came out wrong, a loopy full toss slower ball which Irfan lets through to the keeper then questions if it should have been a no-ball. Waist height to Irfan is a beaming to other players
47.5: full outside off, jabbed to point...crowd cheering the blocks from Irfan
47.6: a straight, low full toss which is carefully pushed to cover so he survives the over
48.1: a yorker which is driven firmly to cover who is on the edge of the circle
48.2: top edge, but falls into space! And in the end it's a dot ball. Back of a length, heaves to the leg side, takes a top edge and doesn't carry to long on
48.3: cracked straight down the ground this time and the run is declined again
48.4: this time he gets it! Short of a length, Wahab keeps swinging hard and he muscles it over deep midwicket to bring up Pakistan's 200
48.5: full on the pads, deflects into the leg side, straight back to the bowler so can't get the single
48.6: works a low full toss into the vacant midwicket area and trots the single
49.1: another fantastic strike! Not the best delivery from Woakes, a driveable length outside off, and it gets absolutely hammered, flat over long-off
49.2: he's given lbw but reviews straight away. Hit it? Yes, massive inside edge into the back pad so this will be overturned
49.3: he's given lbw again! And he reviews again. Wasn't an instant review this time. This one might be missing leg. Hit the back foot full, but very leg-side. Missing leg stump. He survives again. What scenes
49.4: now he tries to scoop, gets across outside off and flicks it behind square on the leg side
49.5: cleaned up! Full, straight, Irfan swung and Woakes hit off stump...he finishes with four wickets, so eight in his last two innings
